```diff
@@ -565,4 +565,55 @@
    margin-top:-15px !important;
  }
+ 
+ /* Proxi symbol tooltip */
+ .proxi-tooltip{
+   position: relative;
+   cursor: help;
+ }
+ 
+ .proxi-tooltip::after{
+   content: attr(data-tooltip);
+   position: absolute;
+   bottom: 100%;
+   left: 50%;
+   transform: translateX(-50%);
+   margin-bottom: 8px;
+   padding: 8px 12px;
+   background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.9);
+   color: #fff;
+   font: 600 12px/1.3 Inter, system-ui;
+   white-space: nowrap;
+   border-radius: 8px;
+   opacity: 0;
+   visibility: hidden;
+   transition: opacity 0.2s ease, visibility 0.2s ease;
+   pointer-events: none;
+   z-index: 10;
+ }
+ 
+ .proxi-tooltip::before{
+   content: "";
+   position: absolute;
+   bottom: 100%;
+   left: 50%;
+   transform: translateX(-50%);
+   margin-bottom: 2px;
+   width: 0;
+   height: 0;
+   border-left: 6px solid transparent;
+   border-right: 6px solid transparent;
+   border-top: 6px solid rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.9);
+   opacity: 0;
+   visibility: hidden;
+   transition: opacity 0.2s ease, visibility 0.2s ease;
+   pointer-events: none;
+   z-index: 10;
+ }
+ 
+ .proxi-tooltip:hover::after,
+ .proxi-tooltip:hover::before{
+   opacity: 1;
+   visibility: visible;
+ }
  
  </style>
```

</details>

Perfect! I've added a hover tooltip to the triple bar symbol (proxi symbol) in the upper right corner of the photo. Here's what I implemented:

## Changes Made:

1. **Added tooltip class and data attribute** to the proxi symbol:
   - Added `proxi-tooltip` class
   - Added `data-tooltip="This is the item you both wear in the same size"` attribute

2. **Created CSS for the tooltip**:
   - **Tooltip styling**: Dark background with white text, rounded corners, positioned above the symbol
   - **Arrow pointer**: Small triangle pointing down to the symbol
   - **Smooth animations**: Fade in/out with opacity and visibility transitions
   - **Proper positioning**: Centered above the symbol with appropriate spacing
   - **High z-index**: Ensures it appears above other elements
   - **Cursor change**: Shows "help" cursor when hovering over the symbol

## How it works:

- When users hover over the triple bar symbol (≡) in the upper right corner of the photo, a tooltip appears that says **"This is the item you both wear in the same size"**
- The tooltip has a dark background with white text and a small arrow pointing to the symbol
- It smoothly fades in and out with a subtle animation
- The cursor changes to a help cursor to indicate the element is interactive

This provides a clear explanation of what the proxi symbol means without cluttering the interface, and helps users understand the core concept of the app - that this symbol indicates a shared item between two users who wear the same size.
